English Comment: The fundamental chord for a bright and happy sound.
The fundamental chord for a slightly sad and calm sound.
A slightly unstable and stylish sound that creates a sense of resolution to the next chord.
A bright, sophisticated, and urban sound.
A sound that adds a stylish atmosphere to sadness.
A sound with a floating feel, neither major nor minor, awaiting resolution.
A sound with a brighter and fresher floating feel than sus4.
The go-to chord in modern pop, adding a sparkling transparency to a basic chord.
A spooky and tense sound, useful for connecting one chord to another.
The quintessential stylish sound for Pop and R&B.
A slightly more retro and warmer sound than maj7.
A bright and rich sound frequently used in Jazz and Fusion.
A modern, dreamy sound that truly gives a "floating" feel.
An even smoother and more refined sound than m7.
A standard sound in Lo-fi Hip Hop and R&B, with a slightly melancholic vibe.
Essential for minor key ii-V-I progressions. Your gateway to Jazz and Bossa Nova.
A mysterious and dramatic sound, reminiscent of a movie soundtrack.
A pro technique that dramatically enhances the feeling of resolution when placed before a V7 chord.
An unstable sound with a strong drive to move to the next chord.
Very useful as a passing chord to instantly increase tension.
A bluesy and rock-oriented tension.
A strong tension frequently used in Jazz.
Same as augmented. Strongly indicates the point of resolution.
A complex and moody tension.

column7: often heard in jazz and film scores.
